intro: Pilosella adenoclada, commonly known as the woolly pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage and spherical, yellowish flower heads that resemble pincushions. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Pilosella adenoclada is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
